decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill the graveyard with cards using effects like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry. This allows the player to cast Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix for reduced mana costs, and also enables delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to come into play early. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful threats and recurring creatures like Bloodghast, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt to close out the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Human creature type to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It uses cards like Thalia, Reflector Mage, and Champion of the Parish to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a powerful board presence. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, creating surprise attacks and tricky combat situations. The combination of disruptive creatures and efficient beaters make it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and win the game.

The key concept of this deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana early in the game. This allows for powerful late game plays, such as casting big threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also focuses on control elements with cards like Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, and Dismember to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions.

The key concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a board presence of artifact creatures and utilize cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to pump up their power and toughness, while also benefiting from the affinity mechanic to cast cards for cheap. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a combination of artifact creatures, pump spells, and mana acceleration, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in the Modern format.

The main idea of this deck is to focus on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana in order to cast powerful colorless threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also features control elements such as Oblivion Stone, Karn Liberated, and Pyroclasm to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own win conditions. Additionally, card selection and mana fixing are important with spells like Ancient Stirrings, Expedition Map, and Sylvan Scrying.

The main theme of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategies while maintaining a strong card advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and efficient removal spells like Terminate and Fatal Push. By using cards like Serum Visions and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to filter through its library quickly to find the right answers for any situation. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage engines, the deck looks to control the pace of the game and eventually close it out with a powerful finisher like Tasigur, the Golden Fang.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Bloodghast, allowing you to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. By using cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting, you can continuously dredge and bring back creatures from your graveyard, overwhelming your opponent with a swarm of creatures. Additionally, cards like Seismic Assault and Conflagrate provide additional avenues for dealing damage to your opponent, while maintaining control of the game through constant dredging.

This deck focuses on quickly putting aggressive Human creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow your creatures, along with disruption from cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast clock. Additionally, the deck uses Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a strong mana base and a variety of disruptive creatures, this deck aims to win quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Farseek and Explore, to eventually play Scapeshift and sacrifice lands to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Primeval Titan helps to search for Valakut or additional Mountains, while cards like Summoner's Pact and Prismatic Omen help to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Roast to deal with threats from the opponent.

The key strategy of this UR Control deck is to efficiently control the board using counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive enchantments like Blood Moon and Spreading Seas. By denying your opponent resources and leveraging card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, you aim to outvalue and outmaneuver your opponent until you can secure a victory through incremental advantage. The deck's versatile card selection and powerful finishers allow you to adapt to a variety of matchups and grind out wins over the course of a longer game.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence of aggressive Human creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Cards like Noble Hierarch and Champion of the Parish help accelerate the deck's aggression, while cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's key cards. Cards like Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory help ensure that creatures can hit the battlefield quickly and efficiently. With a mix of evasion, disruption, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cycle through your cards and cascade into your combo pieces, such as Living End, Demonic Dread, and Violent Outburst. By cascading into Living End, you can wipe the board of creatures and bring your own powerful creatures back from the graveyard. Additionally, cards like Beast Within and Fulminator Mage can disrupt your opponent's game plan while you build up your board presence. This deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their strategy with targeted removal.
